prompt:
---
name: Speech Tag
description: Determine the part of speech for a given word
source: "modified from 'SAMMO: A general-purpose framework for prompt optimization'"
url: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/uploads/prod/2024/04/Prompts-As-Programs_A-Structure-Aware-Approach.pdf
inputs:
    sentenceword:
        type: string
sample:
    sentenceword: "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.; jumps"
tags:
  - sample
  - unlisted
  - paper
scenarios:
  - name: English
    instructions: The user speaks and writes in English.
  - name: French
    instructions: The user speaks and writes in French.
---
system:
In this task, you will be presented with a sentence and a word contained
in that sentence. You have to determine the part of speech for a given word
and return just the tag for the word's part of speech. 

Return only the part of speech tag.  If the word cannot be tagged with
the listed tags, return Unknown.  If you are unable to tag the word, return
CantAnswer.

Here is the
Alphabetical list of part-of-speech tags used in this task: CC: Coordinating conjunction, CD: Cardinal number, DT:
Determiner, EX: Existential there, FW: Foreign word, IN: Preposition or subordinating conjunction, JJ: Adjective, JJR:
Adjective, comparative, JJS: Adjective, superlative, LS: List item marker, MD: Modal, NN: Noun, singular or mass, NNS: Noun,
plural, NNP: Proper noun, singular, NNPS: Proper noun, plural, PDT: Predeterminer, POS: Possessive ending, PRP: Personal
pronoun, PRP$: Possessive pronoun, RB: Adverb, RBR: Adverb, comparative, RBS: Adverb, superlative, RP: Particle, SYM: Symbol,
TO: to, UH: Interjection, VB: Verb, base form, VBD: Verb, past tense, VBG: Verb, gerund or present participle, VBN: Verb,
past participle, VBP: Verb, non-3rd person singular present, VBZ: Verb, 3rd person singular present, WDT: Wh-determiner, WP:
Wh-pronoun, WP$: Possessive wh-pronoun, WRB: Wh-adverb
user:
{{sentenceword}}
inputSpec:
The input is a JSON-like structure with keys for a sentence and a word. 
The sentence should be a grammatically valid string containing one or more words.  
The sentence should not have special characters or symbols that are not part of normal linguistic usage.  
The sentence has no restrictions on minimum or maximum length.  
The sentence should be written using valid and recognizable language constructs.  
The word should be a substring within the given sentence.  
The word should not include punctuation unless it belongs to the word itself (e.g., possessive or contractions).  
The word should match one occurrence within the sentence, either exactly or partially depending on linguistic context.  
The word is not restricted by length but should not exceed the maximum token limit of the chatbot if one exists.
rules: The output must always consist of only one word, which represents a valid part-of-speech tag from the provided alphabetical list or one of the accepted non-list options, "Unknown" or "CantAnswer".

If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must be exactly one of those part-of-speech tags written in uppercase without any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.

If the given word's part of speech cannot be categorized under the tags in the alphabetical list but still has a identifiable part of speech, the output must be "Unknown", written exactly as shown and must not include any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.

If the chatbot is unable to process or determine the part of speech for the provided word, the output must be "CantAnswer", written exactly as shown and must not include any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.

The output must not include explanations, context, or any other surrounding text apart from the required single word as the exact response (either from the list or one of the alternatives "Unknown" or "CantAnswer").

Each output must strictly adhere to the capitalization format provided, with all part-of-speech tags written in uppercase, and both "Unknown" and "CantAnswer" written in sentence capitalization as specified.
If "CantAnswer" is chosen as the output, it must signify the chatbot was completely unable to process or make a determination for any unspecified reason.
If "Unknown" is chosen as the output, it must signify the word has a recognizable part of speech, but does not align with the provided list specifically.
The response must not include more than one word under any circumstances.
inverseRules: The output must never consist of only one word, and it must represent an invalid part-of-speech tag or any unaccepted option other than "Unknown" or "CantAnswer".

If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must include at least two of those tags concatenated with additional characters, spaces, or punctuation marks.

If the given word's part of speech cannot be categorized under the tags in the alphabetical list but still has an identifiable part of speech, the output must not include "Unknown" or any other recognizable label; instead, it must contain added context, phrases, or alternate formatting.
If the chatbot is unable to process or determine the part of speech for the provided word, the output must not be "CantAnswer"; it must instead provide an explanation or reasoning in multi-line text.

The output must include explanations, surrounding text, or context apart from the expected response, exceeding one word and deviating from the required format (from the list or one of the alternatives "Unknown" or "CantAnswer").
Each output must ignore the capitalization format provided, using lowercase for all part-of-speech tags and altered capitalization for both "unknown" and "cantanswer".
If "CantAnswer" is chosen as the output, it must never signify the chatbot was unable to process; instead, it must imply a specific reason for failure.
If "Unknown" is chosen as the output, it must not signify the word has a recognizable part of speech but misaligns with the provided list, and it must include justification or commentary.
The response must include more than one word under all circumstances.
